column4: Is there a way to force flash drives to be bootable in ubuntu?
Yeah but it still wont boot from them unless its bootable. Im trying to boot a file which you would usually put to a floppy disk and tick the "make bootable" button while formatting.
Ahh. Why do you need this file? I'm curious.
its a .bat I need to run to update my motherboard.
You could try using Google and putting in bootable USB drive
Hmm. Maybe you'll have to do something like that. :\
Can you burn an ISO or something? Try Google USB BIOS update
Im running into the same problem there. I can't work out how to force a disk to be bootable when i burn it in ubuntu
I wish I knew what to do :(.
Do you dual boot with Windows?
I did... I just formatted my windows drive for the first time since getting this motherboard. So thats when the prob started.
If you have a spare hard drive remove your current one, run a Windows install or something. :\
Lemme ask some people who visit another site who are overclockers and they might have an idea.
